intro: Uranthera dicranophora, commonly known as the broad-leaved uranthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its wide, flat leaves and clusters of small, spike-like flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist soil conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
